did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Isle of Wight County (Va.) County Court Records, 1771-1913 (bulk 1780-1875)
did.physloc: Library of Virginia. Some Records in this collection may be located at the State Records Center. Contact Archives Research Services for access information, direction and hours.
did.origination: Isle of Wight County (Va.) Circuit Court

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Isle of Wight County (Va.) County Court Records, 1771-1913 (bulk 1780-1875). Local government records collection, Isle of Wight County County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These records came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers Isle of Wight County, Va.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Isle of Wight County was most likely named for the Isle of Wight of the south coast of England. It was first known as Warrosquyoake and was one of the eight shires established in 1634. The present name was given in 1637. Part of Nansemond County was added in 1769.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Isle of Wight County (Va.) County Court Records, 1771-1913 (bulk 1780-1875), consits of Delivery Bonds, 1790-1798; 1800-1801; 1828, Ended Causes, 1857-1875, Executions, 1778-1913, Form Books, 1771-1780, Replevin Bonds, 1788-1801,Judgements 1784-1904 and Order Book 1780-1783.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Isle of Wight County records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.
